ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient's presentation closely aligns with symptoms seen in similar cases, including infantile spasms, generalized hypotonia, global developmental delay, and hypsarrhythmia. EEG findings also support this diagnosis.
Characterized by infantile spasms and hypsarrhythmia, this disease fits some of the major symptoms presented by the patient, although it does not encompass all findings such as focal seizures.
This syndrome includes various seizure types, including infantile spasms, and can lead to developmental delays. The presence of focal seizures in the patient may suggest overlap with this condition.
